ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription:
The patient [I] understood that his/her [my] thoughts, feelings, and behaviors can contribute
to his/her [my] depression.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Half the Time; 4= Most of the Time; 5= Always or When Needed

ElementDescription:
The patient [I] examined his/her [my] underlying assumptions (or schema) and how they
contributed to his/her [my] depression.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Half the Time; 4= Most of the Time; 5= Always or When Needed

ElementDescription: The patient [I] identified automatic negative thoughts and completed thought records.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Half the Time; 4= Most of the Time; 5= Always or When Needed

ElementDescription: The patient [I] scheduled and participated in activities which improved his/her [my] mood.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Half the Time; 4= Most of the Time; 5= Always or When Needed

ElementDescription: The patient [I] looked for alternative explanations when he/she [I] had negative thoughts.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Half the Time; 4= Most of the Time; 5= Always or When Needed

ElementDescription: The patient [I] weighed the evidence for and against negative thoughts.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Half the Time; 4= Most of the Time; 5= Always or When Needed

ElementDescription: The patient [I] tested negative automatic thoughts or beliefs by setting up experiments.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Half the Time; 4= Most of the Time; 5= Always or When Needed

ElementDescription: The patient [I] stated his/her [my] thoughts in ways that could be tested.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Half the Time; 4= Most of the Time; 5= Always or When Needed

ElementDescription: How often have you used the following tool or skill in the past week (or for discharge assessment, since you started this study)? I noticed when I was thinking the worst about a distressing situation and examined my thinking.
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Almost never; 2=Half the time; 3=Most of the time; 4=Always or when needed

ElementDescription: How often have you used the following tool or skill in the past week (or for discharge assessment, since you started this study)? I identified my negative thoughts at the time when I experienced them.
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Almost never; 2=Half the time; 3=Most of the time; 4=Always or when needed

ElementDescription: How often have you used the following tool or skill in the past week (or for discharge assessment, since you started this study)? I looked for alternative explanations when I had distressing thoughts.
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Almost never; 2=Half the time; 3=Most of the time; 4=Always or when needed

ElementDescription: How often have you used the following tool or skill in the past week (or for discharge assessment, since you started this study)? I understood that my thoughts can have an effect on my feelings and behaviors.
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Almost never; 2=Half the time; 3=Most of the time; 4=Always or when needed

ElementDescription: How often have you used the following tool or skill in the past week (or for discharge assessment, since you started this study)? I evaluated my thinking when I experienced a distressing emotion.
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Almost never; 2=Half the time; 3=Most of the time; 4=Always or when needed

ElementDescription: How often have you used the following tool or skill in the past week (or for discharge assessment, since you started this study)? I wrote down my negative thoughts in order to evaluate them.
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Almost never; 2=Half the time; 3=Most of the time; 4=Always or when needed

ElementDescription: How often have you used the following tool or skill in the past week (or for discharge assessment, since you started this study)? I weighed the evidence for and against my negative thoughts.
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Almost never; 2=Half the time; 3=Most of the time; 4=Always or when needed

ElementDescription: How often have you used the following tool or skill in the past week (or for discharge assessment, since you started this study)? I noticed when I overestimated the likelihood of a negative outcome to a situation and examined my thinking.
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Almost never; 2=Half the time; 3=Most of the time; 4=Always or when needed
